Name.label: Syndrome with limb duplication, polydactyly, syndactyly, and/or hyperphalangy

TextSection.Contents: Eyebrow duplication-syndactyly syndrome is characterised by partial duplication of the eyebrows and syndactyly of the fingers and toes. It has been described in three patients (a brother and sister and an isolated case). Skin hyperelasticity, hypertrichosis and long eyelashes, and abnormal periorbital wrinkling were also reported in some of the patients. Transmission is autosomal recessive.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
